availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: A Kentucky blacksmith, attorney, soldier, and politician. Admitted to the bar and practiced law in Hodgenville, Kentucky, Shelbyville, Kentucky, Elizabethtown, Kentucky, and Louisville, Kentucky. Married to Lottie C. Read. Father of William D. Read, Mary D. Read, and Thomas Doran Read. Served as a private and ensign in the Mexican-American War. Served as (deputy) sheriff in LaRue County in 1850. Served as a member of the Kentucky House of Representatives as a representative from LaRue County. Served the Third Congressional District as a member of the First and Second Confederate Congress in the House of Representatives from 1862 to 1865.

bibl.p: Ezra J. Warner and W. Buck Yearns, Biographical Register of the Confederate Congress (Baton Rouge: Louisiana State University Press, 1975), 202-203; Lewis Collins and Richard Collins, History of Kentucky, vol. 1 (Collins & Company, 1882), 353; “A Brave Man’s memory . . . Courageous Career of Col. H. E. Read,” Courier-Journal (Louisville, Ky.), July 23, 1882; Acts of the General Assembly of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, Passed, vol. 1 (Frankfort: A. G. Hodges, State Printer, 1854), 188; “Henry English Read,” (http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=6865338) (accessed January 12, 2017); Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, LaRue County, Hamilton District; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, 7th Ward City of Louisville, p. 101.
